reviewText:
Hoffman, original and through Offenbach, is a romantic character. This version, is a charade
on the verge of very bad taste... even if the singing is quite acceptable. For an 'update'
on the early 'original' version, I would much prefer the 'psiquiatric' approach with Van Dam. Hendricks, etc...
even if that one is already old enough. For classical ones, Domingo et al...

Totally unique interpretation of this classic. I've come to expect the unexpected from Bregenzer in all aspects of staging, costuming, and effects. This certainly didn't disappoint! To have one of the characters look like Offenbach was a great idea.
